{{Infobox person | name = Raphael H Cohen | birth_date = {{birth year and age|1953}} | residence = Geneva, Switzerland | nationality = Swiss | occupation = [[:wikt:principal#English-partner or owner|Principal]], Management Boosters, Professor, Academic director, Author, Speaker }}
'''Raphael Cohen''' (born 1953) is a professor, lecturer, author, serial entrepreneur and [[business angel]]. He has a PhD in economics from Switzerland.<ref>{{cite web|title=RAPHAEL COHEN SERIAL-ENTREPRENEUR and BUSINESS BOOSTER|url=http://getratex.ch/left3_1.html|work=Management Boosters|accessdate=14 June 2013}}</ref>
He is the owner and managing director of Getratex SA, as well as academic director of the entrepreneurship and business development specialization of the eMBA at the University of Geneva.<ref>{{cite web|title=Raphael Cohen - CEO at Getratex SA|url=http://www.world-entrepreneurship-forum.com/Communities/Members/Cohen-Raphael|work=World Entrepreneurship Forum|accessdate=14 June 2013}}</ref>
He has been managing an international group of companies since before earning his PhD in economics in 1982.
Raphael has come up with the IpOp Model, an approach to innovation and corporate entrepreneurship.<ref>{{cite journal|last=Raphael|first=Cohen|author2=Heribert Watzke Jerome Katz |title=USASBE 2010 Workshop -IpOp Model and Opportunity Case|year=2010|url=https://www.scribd.com/doc/59854046/USASBE-2010-Workshop-IpOp-Model-and-Opportunity-Case-2-8-6-3|accessdate=14 June 2013}}</ref> This model is one of several attempting to help companies in their innovation management.
==Life and early career== Cohen started his career at Getratex SA in 1975, where his first intrapreneurial opportunity was to create a new business unit to sell fashion wear. This unit eventually became one of the most dynamic licensees of Walt Disney as the first to sell Disney sportswear successfully to adults in North America and Europe. To reduce his exposure to the fashion industry, in 1980 he initiated a diversification, which led him to invest in several startups. Since he became a business angel Cohen has been involved in many businesses including tourist attractions, theming of public areas, surface treatments, financial derivatives, internet marketing, software, skin treatments, retail, real estate, construction and high-tech projects. As a trusted advisor for several large corporations he became an expert in corporate innovation and intrapreneurship.
==Career==
===Management Boosters=== Cohen started Management Boosters in 2001, as a division of Getratex SA, to provide corporate clients with consulting and training services focusing on the acquisition of competitive advantages. Management Boosters offers training, consulting, mentoring & coaching, facilitation and lecturing.
===University of Geneva === Since 2001, Cohen has been the academic co-director of the entrepreneurship specialization of the eMBA of the University of Geneva, Switzerland, to design and run the first MBA in continental Europe focusing on innovation, entrepreneurship and business development <ref>{{cite web|title=Hec Geneve|url=http://www.hec.unige.ch/index.php?option=com_k2&view=item&layout=item&id=126&Itemid=423&lang=fr|work=Website Of Universite De Geneve|accessdate=14 June 2013}}</ref>
==Academic contributions ==
===IpOp Model === Cohen developed the IpOp Model as a potential roadmap during the pre-project/ideation stage of seizing an opportunity. The model is meant to help innovators analyze and mature their idea to produce an opportunity case or a business plan to convince themselves and decision-makers, such as investors or management of the merits of the opportunity. <ref>{{cite web|title=Raphael Cohen CEO at Getratex SA|url=http://www.world-entrepreneurship-forum.com/Communities/Members/Cohen-Raphael|work=World Entrepreneurship Forum|accessdate=14 June 2013}}</ref>
===MicroMBA MB=== To help organizations benefit from the innovative ability of their employees Cohen has designed and implemented the MicroMBA MB program. Combining the IpOp Model with the fundamentals taught in an executive MBA, the MicroMBA MB enables middle managers to become proactive agents of change. Participants in the program must identify and implement a real project that supports the strategy of their employer. These projects translate into a measurable return of investment for the organization, turning training into a profit center.<ref>{{cite web|title=Turning Caterpillars Into Agile And Passionate Butterflies|url=http://www.winning-opportunities.org/?page_id=74|work=Winning Opportunities|accessdate=14 June 2013}}</ref>
==Awards and honors== * 1971 - Topali Award for special research in natural sciences (biology) * 1972 - Gillet Award for the highest ranking Maturité graduating scientific student in Geneva * 1972 - Hentsch Award for the best French essay in Geneva * 1983 - Award from the Geneva Chamber of Commerce for Meaningful Contribution to Swiss Economy
==Bibliography== *"Modèle de comptabilisation des transactions en devises", Economica, Paris, 1985<ref>{{cite web|title=Modèle De Comptabilisation Des Transactions En Devises|url=https://books.google.com/books/about/Mod%C3%A8le_de_comptabilisation_des_transact.html?id=T-LyNAAACAAJ|work=Google|accessdate=15 June 2013}}</ref> *”Concevoir et lancer un projet”, Cohen, Raphael, Editions d’organisation, Paris, 2006<ref>{{cite web|title=Turning Caterpillars Into Agile And… Passionate Butterflies|url=http://www.winning-opportunities.org/?page_id=74|work=Winning Opportunities|accessdate=15 June 2013}}</ref> * “Winning Opportunities, proven tools for converting your projects into success (without a business plan)”, Cohen, Raphael H, www.winning-opportunities.org, 2011.<ref>{{cite web|title=Turning Caterpillars Into Agile And… Passionate Butterflies|url=http://www.winning-opportunities.org/?page_id=74|work=Winning Opportunities|accessdate=15 June 2013}}</ref>
==Academic diplomas== * 1975 Licence en Sciences Commerciales et Industrielles - Université de Genève *1982 Doctorat en Sciences Economiques (Ph.D.), University of Geneva<ref>{{cite web|title=Cohen Raphael|url=http://www.hec.unige.ch/index.php?option=com_k2&view=item&layout=item&id=126&Itemid=423&lang=en|work=Université de Genève}}</ref> * 1988 Diploma of the Institute of Real-estate Studies - post graduate degree in real estate, Geneva
==References== {{Reflist}}
==External links== *[http://www.getratex.ch/left3_1.html Official Bio] *[http://www.winning-opportunities.org Book ](free download)
{{Use mdy dates|date=August 2011}} {{Authority control}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Cohen, Raphael H}} [[Category:1953 births]] [[Category:Swiss educators]] [[Category:Swiss businesspeople]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Swiss writers]]

{{Infobox dot-com company | name = Reflektion | logo = Reflektion_logo,_updated_August_2015.png | foundation = 2012 | location = [[San Mateo, California]] | founder = Amar Chokhawala | industry = [[E-Commerce]], [[Predictive Analytics]] | url = {{URL|http://reflektion.com/}} }} '''Reflektion''' is a software company founded by former [[Google]] engineer Amar Chokhawala in 2012. Employing [[machine learning]], the company has developed a next-generation [[personalization]] platform that raises conversion and revenue by 20%+ (on average) for leading digital retailers.<ref>{{Cite web|title = Startup of the Year delivers on the promise of personalization|url = https://nrf.com/news/startup-of-the-year-delivers-the-promise-of-personalization|website = National Retail Federation|access-date = 2016-02-23|last = elenstarj@nrf.com}}</ref> The solution, referred to as Individualized Commerce, captures shopper preferences and behavior, and quickly responds to site visitors with the most individually relevant merchandise and site-search results. Chokhawala founded the company after an 11-year stint at Google,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://reflektion.com/about.html |title=About Reflektion}}</ref> where he developed similar user modeling and semantic learning techniques for the Adsense, [[Gmail]] and [[Google Books]] platforms.
Notable clients using the Reflektion platform include [[The Walt Disney Company]], [[Uniqlo]], [[Gander Mountain]], [[Godiva]], and [[The Green Bay Packers]].<ref>{{Cite web|title = Reflektion Closes $18 Million in Series B Funding Led by Battery Ventures|url = http://www.marketwired.com/press-release/reflektion-closes-18-million-in-series-b-funding-led-by-battery-ventures-2099148.htm|website = Marketwire|access-date = 2016-02-23}}</ref> Published client results include Surfboard retailer O’Neill,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.retailtouchpoints.com/features/retail-success-stories/o-neill-amplifies-site-engagement-by-85-with-site-personalization |title=O’Neill Amplifies Site Engagement By 85% With Site Personalization |last=Fiorletta|first=Alicia |date=March 19, 2014 |work= |publisher=Retail Touch Points}}</ref> which reported a 26% increase in [[conversion rate]], 85% increase in user engagement, and 17% increase in average order size.
Based in [[San Mateo, California]], Reflektion has gone through two major rounds of [[venture capital]] fundraising. The company has raised $29.3 million since 2012, with $18 Million in Series B Funding Led by [[Battery Ventures]]<ref>{{Cite web|title = A Personal Shopper at Your Fingertips: How Reflektion is Tapping Artificial Intelligence to Revolutionize E-Commerce - Powered by Battery|url = https://www.battery.com/powered/a-personal-shopper-at-your-fingertips-how-reflektion-is-tapping-artificial-intelligence-to-revolutionize-e-commerce/|website = Powered by Battery|access-date = 2016-02-23|language = en-US}}</ref> in February 2016 and $8 million<ref>{{cite web |url=https://techcrunch.com/2014/03/04/reflektion-raises-8m-from-intel-nike-to-help-retailers-predict-what-shoppers-will-buy-next/ |title=Reflektion Raises $8M From Intel, Nike To Help Retailers Predict What Shoppers Will Buy Next |last=Mishra|first=Pankaj |date=March 4, 2014 |work= |publisher=TechCrunch}}</ref> of that coming in as Series A funding through [[Intel]] Capital and [[Nike, Inc.|Nike]]<ref>{{cite web |url=https://venturebeat.com/2014/03/04/reflektion-raises-8m-to-hypothesize-about-what-you-want-to-buy/ |title=Reflektion raises $8M to hypothesize about what you want to buy |last=Novet|first=Jordan |date=March 4, 2014 |work= |publisher=VentureBeat}}</ref> in March, 2014. Reflektion was named one of the “Top 100 Most Promising Big Data Companies”<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.cioreview.com/outlook/top-100-most-promising-big-data-companies-cid-15-rnktid-3.html |title=Reflektion: Predictive Analytics to Power Brand Managing and Marketing |work= |publisher=CIO Review}}</ref> by industry magazine ''CIO Review'' in 2014. Reflektion was selected by a board of [[National Retail Federation]] judges as the final winner of the 2015 Shop.org Digital Startup of The Year award.<ref>{{Cite web|title = Reflektion Named Winner of Shop.org Startup of the Year Competition|url = https://nrf.com/media/press-releases/reflektion-named-winner-of-shoporg-startup-of-the-year-competition|website = National Retail Federation|access-date = 2016-02-23|last = reynoldst@nrf.com}}</ref>
==References== {{Reflist|30em}}
==External links== *[http://reflektion.com/ Reflektion website]

{{Infobox person | name = Rodolfo De Benedetti | image = Rodolfo De Benedetti.jpg | image_size = 120px | alt = | caption = | birth_name = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1961|07|02}} | birth_place = [[Turin]] | death_date = <!-- {{Death date and age|YYYY|MM|DD|YYYY|MM|DD}} (death date then birth date) --> | death_place = | nationality = | other_names = | occupation = Entrepreneur | years_active = | known_for = | notable_works = }}
'''Rodolfo De Benedetti''' ([[Torino]], 2 July 1961) is an Italian entrepreneur and company executive, Chairman of the [[CIR Group]] (Compagnie Industriali Riunite).
== Biography == Rodolfo De Benedetti was born in [[Turin]] in July 1961, the eldest son of [[Carlo De Benedetti]] and Mita Crosetti. He has two brothers, Marco and Edoardo.
In 1982 he graduated from the [[University of Geneva]] for his Bachelors in Political Economics and in 1985 he graduated with a Law degree. He started working from September 1985 to December 1986 for LODH in Geneva as Assistant to the Chief Executive and, from January 1987 to January 1988, for Shearson Lehman/American Express (New York) as an associate in the merchant banking sector.
Having completed this experience abroad, he began working for the family businesses. From January 1988 to March 1989, he was Director of International Affairs for COFIDE. From 1990 to 1993, he held the position of General Manager of [[CIR Group]] and, from 1989 to 1995, also of COFIDE.
From his entry into the family business, Rodolfo De Benedetti worked on restructuring the [[CIR Group]], transforming it into a diversified holding company.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ft.com/cms/s/0/8a2e6f62-b4f4-11de-8b17-00144feab49a.html#axzz1E8M1dhhX|title=Scion reshapes media group - FT.com|publisher=}}</ref> Today, the CIR group consists essentially of three industrial businesses: SOGEFI, the international automotive components group that is among the world leaders in the production of engine systems and suspension components; [[Gruppo Editoriale L'Espresso]], one of the main publishing and multimedia groups in Italy; KOS, which is one of the top private operators in the care-home sector in Italy.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://video.ft.com/4277996353001/CIR-keeping-it-in-the-family/Companies|title=CIR – keeping it in the family - View from the Top - Companies & Management Video - FT.com|publisher=}}</ref>
Since 2014, he has been a shareholder and partner of Decalia, the international asset management company based in Geneva.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bilan.ch/bilan-entreprises/nouvelle-societe-dalfredo-piacentini-recrute-cote-de-chez-syz|title=La nouvelle société d’Alfredo Piacentini recrute chez Syz|publisher=}}</ref>
Rodolfo De Benedetti was previously Chief Executive of [[CIR Group]] and COFIDE. he is on the Board of Directors of [[Gruppo Editoriale L'Espresso]], SOGEFI and of Decalia Asset Management.
Since 2006, Rodolfo De Benedetti has been a member of the European Advisory Board of the [[Harvard Business School]], while since November of the same year, he has been a member of the [[European Round Table of Industrialists]].
In March 2013, his father Carlo De Benedetti transferred control of the group to him and his brothers Marco and Edoardo, free of charge. Following this transfer, in April 2013, Rodolfo De Benedetti was appointed Chairman of COFIDE and of the [[CIR Group]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://af.reuters.com/article/energyOilNews/idAFI6E8LC01L20121029|title=Italy's CIR founder De Benedetti hands over control to sons - Energy & Oil - Reuters|publisher=}}</ref>
==Personal== Rodolfo De Benedetti is married to the writer Emmanuelle de Villepin and has three daughters, Neige, Alix, and Mita.
== References == <!--- See [[Wikipedia:Footnotes]] on how to create references using tags which will then appear here automatically --> {{Reflist}}
== External links == {{commonscatinline}} * {{official|http://www.cirgroup.com}}

{{Orphan|date=July 2015}}
{{Infobox person | name = Sergio Gordilho | image = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1970|5|16}} | birth_place = Brazil | education = Universidade Federal da Bahia, Royal College of Art – London, Berlin School of Creative Leadership | occupation = Co- president and Chief Creative Officer of Agência Africa, Partner of ABC Group - Grupo ABC |nationality = Brazilian }}
'''Sergio Gordilho''', (Salvador, May 16, 1970), is a businessman and creative director. Gordilho is co-president and chief creative officer of Africa agency, one of the ten largest advertising agency (agencies) in Brazil and a partner of ABC Group, the largest communications holding company in [[Latin America]].<ref name=dci>{{cite web |url = http://www.valor.com.br/empresas/3832824/grupo-abc-tem-nova-composicao-acionaria |title= Grupo ABC tem nova composicao acionaria |accessdate = 2015-03-11 |publisher = Valor Econômico |language = Portuguese |date = 2014-12-22}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url = http://www.dci.com.br/especial/grupo-africa-estima-expansao-de-15-id375934.html |title = Grupo Africa estima expansão de 15% |accessdate = 2015-03-11 |publisher = DCI |language = Portuguese |date = 2014-11-12 }}</ref>
==Career== Gordilho graduated from Universidade Federal da Bahia with a degree in architecture. He also has a graduate degree in Graphic Design from [[Royal College of Art]] in London and a MBA (Master Business Administration) from [[Berlin School of Creative Leadership]].<ref>{{cite web |url = https://catracalivre.com.br/geral/premio-cidadao-sao-paulo/indicacao/meio-ambiente/ |title = Meio Ambiente |accessdate = 2015-03-16 |publisher = Catraca Livre |language = Portuguese |date = 2014-11-10 }}</ref>
He began his career as a creative professional working in advertising agencies such as Propeg and SLAP, in [[Salvador, Bahia|Salvador]], his home city. Gordilho lived in London for over a year where he got a graduate degree in Graphic Design from Royal College of Art. In 1999, he moved to São Paulo to work at DM9DDB, where he met his future partner, [[Nizan Guanaes]]. Between 2000 and 2002, he worked in Bates Brasil, the nowadays Y&R (Young and Rubicam).<ref>{{cite web |url = http://www.almanaquedacomunicacao.com.br/entrevista-com-sergio-gordilho/ |title = Entrevista com Sérgio Gordilho |accessdate = 2015-03-16 |publisher = ALMANAQUE DA COMUNICAÇÃO |language = Portuguese |date = 2011-08-12 }}</ref>
In December 2002, Gordilho founded Africa, with partners Nizan Guanaes, [[Marcio Santoro]], Luiz Fernando Vieira and Olivia Machado. According to 2014 statistics, Africa is the seventh largest advertising agency in Brazil and belongs to ABC Group, the largest communications holding company in Latin America.<ref name = folha>{{cite web |url = http://www1.folha.uol.com.br/fsp/dinheiro/fi2503201022.htm |title = Dupla substituirá Nizan na presidência da agência Africa |accessdate = 2015-03-16 |publisher = Folha |author = Mariana Barbosa |language = Portuguese |date = 2010-03-25}}</ref>
Gordilho was named co-president of Agencia Africa, alongside Márcio Santoro in 2010.<ref name = folha/> Under his leadership, the agency is responsible for the communication of brands such as Itaú,Brahma, Vivo, Procter & Gamble, Folha de S.Paulo.<ref>{{cite web |url = http://adage.com/article/special-report-agency-alist-2014/africa-ad-age-s-2014-international-agency-year/291339/ |title = Africa Is Ad Age's 2014 International Agency of the Year |accessdate = 2015-03-16 |publisher = Advertising Age |author = Wentz, Laurel |date = 2014-02-03}}</ref>
==Recognition== Under his leadership in the creative field, Africa won the Caboré award, a Brazilian communications industry award for Communication Agency in 2005 and 2012.<ref>{{cite web |url = http://www.meioemensagem.com.br/home/comunicacao/noticias/2012/12/04/Cabore--Agencia-do-Ano.html |title = Caboré: Agência do Ano |accessdate = 2015-03-16 |publisher = MEIO & MENSAGEM |language = Portuguese |date = 2012-12-04}}</ref>
Gordilho was voted the most influential Creative Professional by the Association of Advertising Professionals in 2006.<ref>{{cite web |url = http://www.appbrasil.net/profiles/blogs/vencedores-do-premio-app-contribuicao-profissional |title = Venderoses do premio APP |accessdate = 2015-03-16 |publisher = APP |language = Portuguese |date = 2014-09-22}}</ref>
Two years later, in 2008, he won the Caboré award again, this time for Creative Professional.<ref>{{cite web |url = http://www.cabore.com.br/eventos/2014/cabore/vencedores.html |title = Vencedores |accessdate = 2015-03-16 |publisher = Caboré |language = Portuguese }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url = http://www.portaldapropaganda.com.br/portal/propaganda/7340-termina-no-pro-domingo-a-vota-do-cabor008- |title = Termina no próximo domingo a votação do Caboré 2008 |accessdate = 2015-03-11 |language = Portuguese |date = 2008-11-26}}</ref> From 2008 to 2014, Africa was voted the most admired advertising agency by Carta Capital magazine.<ref name =vox>{{cite web |url = http://voxnews.com.br/cabore-2014-marcio-santoro-da-africa-dirigente/ |title = Caboré 2014: Marcio Santoro - da Africa - Dirigente |accessdate = 2015-03-16 |publisher = VOX News |language = Portuguese |date = 2014-10-24}}</ref>
In 2014, Gordilho was the only Brazilian voted as “Agency Innovator” appointed by [[The Internationalist]], an international organization that chooses main executives of advertising worldwide. His indication occurred for his work in [[Itau Unibanco|Itaú Bank]]’ commercials during the 2014 FIFA World Cup and the creation of Africa Lab, an intern creative laboratory, responsible for developing projects and products such as Buddy Cup, for Budweiser.<ref>{{cite web |url = http://www.revistafatorbrasil.com.br/ver_noticia.php?not=280416 |title = Sergio Gordilho é eleito Agency Innovator pela The Internationalist |accessdate = 2015-03-16 |publisher = Portal Fator Brasil |language = Portuguese |date = 2014-10-21 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url = http://www.meioemensagem.com.br/home/comunicacao/noticias/2014/10/20/Sergio-Gordilho-em-lista-de-inovadores.html |title = Sergio Gordilho entra em lista de inovadores |accessdate = 2015-03-16 |publisher =MEIO & MENSAGEM |language = Portuguese |date = 2014-10-20 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url = http://economia.estadao.com.br/noticias/geral,festival-de-cannes-anuncia-dezoito-jurados-brasileiros,1636777 |title = Festival de Cannes anuncia dezoito jurados brasileiros |accessdate = 2015-03-16 |publisher = Estadão |language = Portuguese |date = 2015-02-19}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url = http://www.ccsp.com.br/ultimas/dad-2015-3/|title = D&AD 2015|accessdate = 2015-03-16 |publisher = Clube Online |language = Portuguese}}</ref>
==References== {{reflist}}

{{Infobox person | name = Shlomo Grofman | image = Shlomo Grofman-portrait.jpg | image_size = | caption = | occupation = [[Businessperson]] | residence = [[Israel]] |diplomacy = Kenya (2016- ) }}
'''Shlomo Grofman''' is a leading Israeli [[Real estate development|real estate developer]] [[businessperson]]. As of 2016, he is serving as Kenya's honorary consul to Israel.
==Biography==
Shlomo Grofman is a central figure in many sectors of the Israeli business community and is widely acknowledged as one of the most prominent and innovative real estate entrepreneurs.
Shlomo Grofman is the active chairman of Faire Fund (First American Israeli Real Estate Fund), which he established together with former Israeli [[Ambassador]] [[Zalman Shoval]].<ref>{{cite web| url=http://www.faire.co.il/content.php?id=3| title=About Us| publisher=Faire Fund| accessdate=2014-08-10}}</ref> A private [[Stock fund|equity fund]] with a capital of 90 million US dollars, Faire Fund is involved in locating and managing investments such as [[HaYarkon 96]] in real estate development in Israel. Additional, Mr. Grofman is chairman of Shoval Grofman Real Estate Limited.
Shlomo Grofman is currently acting also as chairman of Grofman Holdings Ltd. (a private investment company), Sarel Medical Supplies and Equipment Ltd. (Israel's largest medical supplies company), Sarel Medical Supplies and Equipment Ltd. (Israel's largest medical supplies company) and Ayalon Holdings Ltd (the mother company of Ayalon Insurance a company listed on the Stock Exchange).<ref name="ayalon">{{cite web| url=https://www.ayalon-ins.co.il/about-us/investor-relations-english/board-members-holdings/| title=Board Members Holdings| website=ayalon-ins.co.il| accessdate=2018-11-10}}</ref>
In July 2016 Shlomo Grofman was endorsed by the Governments of Kenya Israel to serve as the Honorary Consul of Kenya in Israel.<ref>{{cite web| url=https://www.jpost.com/Business-and-Innovation/New-honorary-consul-plans-to-boost-trade-relations-with-Kenya-479944| title=New honorary consul plans to boost trade relations with Kenya| publisher=[[Jerusalem Post]]| date=2017-01-29| accessdate=2018-11-10}}</ref>
Shlomo Grofman serves as a member of the Board of Directors of the Israel-America Chamber of Commerce; Deputy Chairman of the Board of Directors of the International March of the Living;<ref>{{cite web| url=https://motl.org/about/| title=ABOUT THE MARCH| website=motl.org| accessdate=2018-11-10}}</ref> and as the Ambassador of the Sheba Medical Center in the United States, and member of the Board of Directors of the Sheba Medical Center New York.<ref name="ayalon" />
From 1978 to 1996 Shlomo Grofman served as managing director and CEO of Africa Israel Investment Company Ltd.<ref>{{cite news| url=http://fr.jpost.com/servlet/Satellite?cid=1210668640857&pagename=JPost/JPArticle/ShowFull| archive-url=https://archive.is/20120708140941/http://fr.jpost.com/servlet/Satellite?cid=1210668640857&pagename=JPost/JPArticle/ShowFull| dead-url=yes| archive-date=2012-07-08| title='Israel is still a hot market for high-end real estate'| author=John Benzaquen| newspaper=[[The Jerusalem Post]]| date=2008-05-15| accessdate=2009-03-24}}</ref> During Mr. Grofman's tenure, Africa Israel has developed into a conglomerate with substantial holdings and interests in real estate development and construction, insurance, industry, energy, hotels and tourism. While Mr. Grofman led Africa Israel, he initiated and supervised highly prosperous investments in residential development, office buildings, shopping malls, industrial parks and hotels. One of the highlights in Africa Israel's diversified real estate activity was the development of new neighborhoods: Savion, Givat Savion, Savioney Aviv, Savioney Gan, Kiryat Hasvionim, Neve Savion and Savioney Yam. These neighborhoods and the brand name Savion have become a synonym for a modern, high standard, fully equipped residential environment. Shlomo Grofman has also served as the [[Chairman#Chair of the Board types and their relation to the company management|Chairman of the Board]] of Denya Cybus Ltd., wholly owned subsidiary of Africa Israel and one of Israel's leading construction and infrastructure companies.
Shlomo Grofman established and developed two major hotel chains in Israel – Holiday Inn and Howard Johnson. As an appreciation for his outstanding achievements in introducing those chains to the Israeli market he was awarded several prizes. From 1992 to 1996 he served as chairman of the board of Holiday Inn Hotels EMEA (Europe, Middle East, Mediterranean & Africa), and member of the World Board of Directors of Holiday Inn International. From 1996 to 1999 he was a member of the World Board of Directors of Howard Johnson Hotels & Inns.
Shlomo Grofman is closely acquainted with the banking and insurance industries. From 1986 to 1988 he was a member of the executive committee of Bank Leumi LeIsrael Ltd. (Israel's second largest bank) and head of the bank's non-banking and financial services division. From 1986 to 1995 he served as the chairman of the board of Migdal Insurance Group. (Israel's largest insurance group) in which the Italian insurance giant Generali held a controlling stake.
Mr. Grofman was a member of the board of directors of Carmel Investment Group Ltd (public investment company) and of Ayalon Holdings Ltd. (investment, properties, holdings and insurance) and as the Chairman of MYMC Ma’aynei Hayeshua Medical Center.
Shlomo Grofman has been involved in numerous voluntary and [[Nonprofit organization|nonprofit]] activities. Among other things, he was governor of Rotary Israel and a special advisor of the World President of Rotary International. He also served as the Chairman of the Friends of the Weitzman Institute. Mr. Grofman is currently chairman of the Board of Trustees of the Interdisciplinary Center for Law, Politics and Business in [[Herzliya]], Chairman of Yuval – the Ensemble for Jewish and Cantorial Music<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.yuval.org.il/yuval/resume_en.asp |title=Yuval the Israeli Ensemble for Chazanut (Cantorial) and Jewish Music |publisher=yuval.org.il |accessdate=2009-03-24 |quote=Presently Mr. Shlomo Grofman serves as its chairman. |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090227072222/http://www.yuval.org.il/yuval/resume_en.asp |archivedate=February 27, 2009 }}</ref> and Member of the Israel-America Chamber of Commerce.

==External links== * {{cite news| url=http://creativesuccessalliance.com/coaching/| title=why many successful people choose to invest in coaching | date=2008-03-01| accessdate=2009-03-24}} * {{cite news| url=http://www.haaretz.com/print-edition/business/building-toward-the-heavens-1.204389| title=Building toward the heavens| author=Arik Mirovsky| newspaper=[[Haaretz]]| date=2006-11-06| accessdate=2014-08-10}} * {{cite news| url=http://www.haaretz.com/print-edition/business/crunch-time-for-the-real-estate-market-1.248775| title=Crunch time for the real estate market?| author=Guy Liberman|author2=Arik Mirovsky| newspaper=[[Haaretz]]| date=2008-06-30| accessdate=2014-08-10}}

{{Infobox film | name = The Wheeler Dealers | image = The Wheeler Dealers FilmPoster.jpeg | image_size = 225px | caption = [[Film poster|Theatrical release poster]] | writer = [[George Goodman]]
[[Ira Wallach (writer)|Ira Wallach]] | starring = [[James Garner]]
[[Lee Remick]] | director = [[Arthur Hiller]] | producer = [[Martin Ransohoff]] | music = [[Frank De Vol]] | cinematography = [[Charles Lang]] | editing = Tom McAdoo | distributor = [[Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer]] | released = {{film date|1963|11|14}} | runtime = 107 minutes | country = United States | language = English | awards = | budget = | gross = $3,200,000 (US/ Canada)"Top Rental Features of 1963", ''Variety'', 8 January 1964 p 71. Please note figures are rentals as opposed to total gross. }} '''''The Wheeler Dealers''''' (a.k.a. '''''Separate Beds''''' in the UK) is a 1963 [[romantic comedy]] film from [[Metro Goldwyn Mayer]], produced by [[Martin Ransohoff]], directed by [[Arthur Hiller]], that stars [[James Garner]] and [[Lee Remick]], and co-stars [[Phil Harris]], [[Chill Wills]], [[Jim Backus]], and [[Patricia Crowley]].''[[Variety Film Reviews|Variety]]'' film review; September 25, 1963, page 6. The film's screenplay was written by [[George Goodman]] and [[Ira Wallach (writer)|Ira Wallach]], based on Goodman's 1959 novel of the same name. Garner was nominated for the [[Golden Globe Award for Best Actor – Motion Picture Musical or Comedy]].{{cite web |url=http://www.goldenglobes.com/person/james-garner?page=1 |title=James Garner |publisher=[[Golden Globe Awards]]}} ==Plot== Molly Thatcher ([[Lee Remick]]) is a stockbroker languishing in a company run by [[Chauvinism#Male chauvinism|male chauvinist]] Bullard Bear ([[Jim Backus]]). When the company does poorly, he will have to fire somebody; As the only female employee, Molly is the obvious choice since if any of the male employees are fired, it would look like the company is in trouble. He assigns her the seemingly impossible task of unloading shares of an obscure company called Universal Widgets; when she fails, he will have an excuse to dismiss her. Molly meets Henry Tyroon ([[James Garner]]), an aggressive wheeler dealer who dresses, talks, and acts like a stereotypical [[Texas]] millionaire. He's more interested in her than in Universal Widgets, but decides to be of help in order to get closer to her. As they spend time together, Molly watches Henry make complicated business deals, often in partnership with his Texan cronies, Jay Ray ([[Chill Wills]]), Ray Jay ([[Phil Harris]]), and J.R. (Charles Watts). One such deal is a venture into dealing modern art, with the aid of Stanislas ([[Louis Nye]]), a cynical [[avant-garde]] painter. Molly and Henry have trouble figuring out Universal Widgets' reason for existence; its only factory burned down around the time of the [[Spanish-American War]]. It manufactures nothing and provides no services. (Widgets had something to do with horse-drawn carriages.) It's just a corporation on paper whose sole asset is a huge block of shares in [[AT&T Corporation|AT&T]], bought long, long ago when the stock was ridiculously cheap. Now it pays out hefty, regular [[dividend]]s to its two complacent shareholders. When Henry makes attempts to take control of Universal Widgets by what appears to be questionable methods, over-enthusiastic government regulator Hector Vanson ([[John Astin]]) takes him to Federal court. Further complications arise when Jay Ray, Ray Jay, and J.R. get Molly fired so that she will spend more time in Texas with Henry. She thinks Henry is responsible after discovering that he is really an Easterner and a Yale University graduate; the Texan act just helps him with his wheeling and dealing. The judge dismisses the Federal Securities Commission case when it is determined that all the Universal Widgets' shares are controlled by just six people, including Henry and the Texans, not the general public; the Texans trio's interest is bought out, then and there, for a sizable profit. The trio also confesses that they were the ones who had Molly fired. After hearing this, she quickly makes up with Henry. ==Cast== *[[James Garner]] as Henry Tyroon *[[Lee Remick]] as Molly Thatcher *[[Phil Harris]] as Ray Jay Fox *[[Chill Wills]] as Jay Ray Spinelby *[[Jim Backus]] as Bullard Bear *[[Louis Nye]] as Stanislas *[[John Astin]] as Hector Vanson *[[Elliott Reid]] as Leonard *[[Pat Harrington Jr.]] as Buddy Zack *[[Joey Forman]] as Buster Yarrow *[[Patricia Crowley]] as Eloise Cott *Charles Watts as J.R. Martin *[[Howard McNear]] as Mr. Wilson *[[Donald Briggs|Don Briggs]] as Len Flink *[[Vaughn Taylor]] as Thaddeus Whipple *[[Robert Strauss (actor)|Robert Strauss]] as Feinberg, Taxi Driver *[[John Marley]] as Achilles Dimitros *[[Peter Leeds]] as Arthur Watkins ==Reception== ''[[The New York Times]]'' reviewer [[Bosley Crowther]] was unimpressed, writing "somehow the script of George J. W. Goodman and Ira Wallach doesn't jell and isn't droll, and Arthur Hiller's direction is too slow for romantic comedy. What might be brightly satiric simply isn't because it lacks wit. Too much double entry and too little double entendre".{{cite news |title=The Wheeler Dealers (1963) |author=Bosley Crowther |newspaper=The New York Times |date=November 15, 1963 |url=https://movies.nytimes.com/movie/review?res=9503E7DA1730E433A25756C1A9679D946291D6CF}} He did, however, like Garner ("spry and briskly charming") and Remick ("cute"). Reviewer [[Glenn Erickson]] characterized it as an "entertaining trifle that, if I read it right, outsmarts itself. Nobody on either side of the camera seems to know that the joke is really on them, and us, and our way of life".{{cite web |url=http://www.dvdtalk.com/dvdsavant/s3572whee.html |title=The Wheeler Dealers |publisher=DVD Savant |accessdate=October 22, 2012}} He thought both stars gave "outstanding performances" and rated the film "Good +". ==Home media== ''The Wheeler Dealers'' was released on June 27, 2011 by Warner Home Video as a widescreen Region 1 DVD via its Warner Archive DVD-on-demand service. The film's [[Blu-ray]] release came on April 25, 2017.{{Citation|title=The Wheeler Dealers Blu-ray|url=http://www.blu-ray.com/movies/The-Wheeler-Dealers-Blu-ray/176089/|accessdate=2017-09-08}} ==See also== *[[List of American films of 1963]] ==References== == External links == * {{IMDb title|0057681|The Wheeler Dealers}} * {{tcmdb title|95463|The Wheeler Dealers}} * {{amg title|54115|The Wheeler Dealers}} {{Arthur Hiller}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Wheeler Dealers, The}} [[Category:1963 films]] [[Category:1960s romantic comedy films]] [[Category:American business films]] [[Category:American films]] [[Category:American romantic comedy films]] [[Category:English-language films]] [[Category:Films scored by Frank De Vol]] [[Category:Films based on American novels]] [[Category:Films directed by Arthur Hiller]] [[Category:Films set in New York City]] [[Category:Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer films]] [[Category:Wall Street films]] [[Category:1960s business films]]

revision.text:
'''Torleif Aasgaard''' (29 April 1888 – 20 June 1953) was a [[Norway|Norwegian]] businessperson.
He was born in [[Oslo|Kristiania]] as a son of Carl Johan Johnsen Aasgaard (1854–1929) and Anna Marie Jensen. He was a younger brother of judge [[Reidar Aasgaard]]. In 1914 he married teacher's daughter Alette Hesselberg.<ref name=hvem>{{cite encyclopedia|year=1948|title=Aasgaard, Torleif|encyclopedia=[[Hvem er hvem?]]|editor=Steenstrup, Bjørn|publisher=Aschehoug|location=Oslo|url=http://runeberg.org/hvemerhvem/1948/0596.html|page=596|language=Norwegian|accessdate=30 January 2014}}</ref>
He [[examen artium|finished]] his secondary education in 1906 and graduated from Kristiania Technical School in 1909. He then spent some time in England and Germany to study the steel industry.<ref name=hvem/><ref name=merkbio>{{cite encyclopedia|title=Aasgaard, Torleif|url=http://runeberg.org/merkbio/0086.html|encyclopedia=[[Merkantilt biografisk leksikon]]|publisher=Yrkesforlaget|location=Oslo|edition=1st|editor-last=Hoffstad|editor-first=Einar|editor-link=Einar Hoffstad|year=1935|page=12|accessdate=30 January 2014|language=Norwegian}}</ref> His father owned and led the metal manufacturing company [[C. Geijer & Co]],<ref name=100y>{{cite news|title=Norges ledende gjerdeprodusent, C. Geijer 100 år|date=13 November 1969|work=[[Aftenposten]]|page=17|language=Norwegian}}</ref> and Torleif Aasgaard was hired as manager in 1911. He later took over the company, as chief executive and chairman.<ref name=hvem/> Leadership was passed on to Tor and Iver Aasgaard in 1952.<ref name=100y/>
He played football for [[SFK Lyn]], and later chaired the club. He served as the first chairman of Oslo District Association of Skiing.<ref name=merkbio/> He was also a board member of ''Jern- og Metallvarefabrikantenes Landsforening'' from 1939 to 1948.<ref name=hvem/> He died in June 1953 and was buried at [[Vår Frelsers gravlund]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.disnorge.no/gravminner/index.php?language=engelsk|title=Cemeteries in Norway|publisher=DIS-Norge|accessdate=30 January 2014}}</ref>
==References== {{Reflist}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Aasgaard, Torleif}} [[Category:1888 births]] [[Category:1953 deaths]] [[Category:People from Oslo]] [[Category:Norwegian businesspeople]] [[Category:Norwegian sports executives and administrators]] [[Category:Burials at Vår Frelsers gravlund]]
{{Norway-business-bio-stub}}

revision.text:
[[File:AGM Annual General Meeting of a typical small (141 member) volunteer organisation.jpg|thumb|Annual General Meeting of a typical very small volunteer non-profit organisation (the Monaro Folk Society) Office bearers sitting are president, secretary and public officer.]] A '''voluntary group''' or '''union''' (also sometimes called a '''voluntary organization''', '''common-interest association''',<ref name=Prins2010>Prins HEL et al. (2010). [https://books.google.com/books?id=yP6TrXRpPdMC Cultural Anthropology: The Human Challenge]. Cengage Learning.</ref>{{Rp|266}} '''association''', or '''society''') is a group of individuals who enter into an agreement, usually as [[Volunteering|volunteer]]s, to form a body (or [[organization]]) to accomplish a purpose.<ref>[http://dictionary.reference.com/browse/association association] Entry at [[Dictionary.reference.com]].</ref> Common examples include [[trade association]]s, [[trade union]]s, [[learned society|learned societies]], [[professional association]]s, and [[Environmental movement|environmental group]]s.
Membership is not necessarily voluntary: in order for particular associations to function correctly they might need to be mandatory or at least strongly encouraged, as is common with many [[teachers union]]s in the US. Because of this, some people use the term common-interest association to describe groups which form out of a common interest, although this term is not widely used or understood.<ref name=Prins2010/>
Voluntary associations may be incorporated or unincorporated; for example, in the US, unions gained additional powers by incorporating.<ref>Bradburn B. (2009). ''[https://books.google.com/books?id=IbqTcM4rrR8C&pg=PA217#v=onepage&q&f=false The Citizenship Revolution: Politics and the Creation of the American Union, 1774–1804]'', p. 217. [[University of Virginia Press]].</ref> In the UK, the terms Voluntary Association or Voluntary Organisation cover every type of group from a small local Residents' Association to large Associations (often [[Registered charity|Registered Charities]]) with multimillion-[[British pound|pound]] turnover that run large-scale business operations (often providing some kind of [[public service]] as subcontractors to government departments or local authorities).
==Differences by jurisdictions== In many [[jurisdiction]]s no formalities are necessary to start an association. In some jurisdictions, there is a minimum for the number of persons starting an association.
Some jurisdictions require that the association register with the police or other official body to inform the public of the association's existence. This could be a tool of political control or intimidation, and also a way of protecting the economy from [[fraud]].
In many such jurisdictions, only a registered association (or in the UK an incorporated body) is a [[juristic person]] whose members are not responsible for the financial acts of the association. Any group of persons may, of course, work as an informal association, but in such cases, each person making a transaction in the name of the association takes responsibility for that transaction, just as if it were that individual's personal transaction.<ref>{{Cite book|title = Robert's Rules of Order Newly Revised|last = Robert|first = Henry M.|publisher = Da Capo Press|year = 2011|isbn = 978-0-306-82020-5|location = Philadelphia, PA|page = 2|edition = 11th|display-authors=etal}}</ref>
There are many countries where the formation of truly independent Voluntary Associations is effectively proscribed by law or where they are theoretically legally permitted, but in practice are persecuted; for example, where membership brings unwelcome attention from police or other state agencies.
==History== [[File:Civil Brainbar (1).jpg|thumb|Civil lecture at Budapest Brainbar]] Voluntary groups are a broad and original form of nonprofit organizations, and have existed since ancient history. In [[Ancient Greece]], for example, there were various organizations ranging from elite clubs of wealthy men (''hetaireiai'')<ref>[https://www.jstor.org/stable/4436529 Politics on the Margins: The Athenian "Hetaireiai" in 415 BC]. ''Historia: Zeitschrift für Alte Geschichte''.</ref> to private religious or professional associations.<ref>Ascough, Richard S. "[http://www.lastseminary.com/the-greco-roman-world/Greco-Roman%20Philosophic%20Religious%20and%20Voluntary%20Associations.pdf Greco-Roman Philosophic, Religious, and Voluntary Associations]". In Community Formation in the Early Church and the Church Today. Edited by Richard N. Longenecker, 3–24. Peabody, MA: Hendrickson, 2002</ref>
In preindustrial societies, governmental administrative duties were often handled by voluntary associations such as [[guild]]s. In medieval Europe, guilds often controlled towns.<ref name=Kohn2003>Kohn M. (2003). [http://papers.ssrn.com/sol3/papers.cfm?abstract_id=427763 Merchant Associations in Pre-Industrial Europe]. Ch. 16 in [http://www.dartmouth.edu/~mkohn/origins.html The Origins of Western Economic Success: Commerce, Finance, and Government in Preindustrial Europe] {{Webarchive|url=https://archive.is/20131114000139/http://www.dartmouth.edu/~mkohn/origins.html |date=2013-11-14 }}.</ref> Merchant guilds enforced contracts through embargoes and sanctions on their members, and also adjudicated disputes.<ref>(1990). The role of institutions in the revival of trade: The law merchant, private judges, and the champagne fairs. [https://www.researchgate.net/publication/227352676_THE_ROLE_OF_INSTITUTIONS_IN_THE_REVIVAL_OF_TRADE_THE_LAW_MERCHANT_PRIVATE_JUDGES_AND_THE_CHAMPAGNE_FAIRS/file/d912f50d1d6a7d7466.pdf The role of institutions in the revival of trade: The law merchant, private judges, and the champagne fairs]. ''Economics & Politics''.</ref> However, by the 1800s, merchant guilds had largely disappeared.<ref>"The Rise and Fall of the Merchant Guilds: Re-thinking the Comparative Study of Commercial Institutions in Premodern Europe". ''Journal of Interdisciplinary History''. [http://vkc.library.uu.nl/vkc/seh/research/Lists/Working%20Papers/Attachments/41/Gelderblom%20and%20Grafe%20on%20Rise%20and%20Fall%20of%20Merchant%20Guilds.pdf Preprint] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131114004524/http://vkc.library.uu.nl/vkc/seh/research/Lists/Working%20Papers/Attachments/41/Gelderblom%20and%20Grafe%20on%20Rise%20and%20Fall%20of%20Merchant%20Guilds.pdf |date=2013-11-14 }}.</ref> [[Economic history|Economic historians]] have debated the precise role that merchant guilds played in premodern society and economic growth.<ref>[http://www.history.ac.uk/reviews/printpdf/review/1102 Review of ''Institutions and European Trade: Merchant Guilds, 1000–1800''] published in ''Reviews in History''.</ref>
In the United Kingdom, craft guilds were more successful than merchant guilds<ref name=Starr1919>[[Mark Starr (labor educationalist)|Starr M]]. (1919). [http://www.marxists.org/archive/starr-mark/worker-looks-history/ch07.htm A Worker Looks At History, Ch. 7: The Guilds]. Plebs League. [https://books.google.com/books/about/A_worker_looks_at_history.html?id=vX1YAAAAMAAJ Google Books entry].</ref> and formed [[livery company|livery companies]] which exerted significant influence on society.<ref>[http://www.history.co.uk/explore-history/history-of-london/the-guilds-and-livery-companies.html History of London The Guilds and Livery Companies] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130529115304/http://www.history.co.uk/explore-history/history-of-london/the-guilds-and-livery-companies.html |date=2013-05-29 }}. History.co.uk.</ref>
==Legal status== A standard definition of an unincorporated association was given by [[Frederick Lawton (judge)|Lord Justice Lawton]] in the [[English trust law]] case ''[[Conservative and Unionist Central Office v Burrell]]'' (1981):<ref>[1981] [http://www.bailii.org/ew/cases/EWCA/Civ/1981/2.html EWCA Civ 2], [1982] 1 WLR 522</ref>
{{quote|"unincorporated association" [means] two or more persons bound together for one or more common purposes, not being business purposes, by mutual undertakings, each having mutual duties and obligations, in an organisation which has rules which identify in whom control of it and its funds rests and upon what terms and which can be joined or left at will.<ref>The definition was for [[taxation|tax]] purposes, but was expressed to be of general application.</ref>}}
In most countries, an unincorporated association does not have [[legal person|separate legal personality]], and few members of the association usually enjoy [[limited liability]].<ref>{{cite web |author1=XU, Y. |author2=Ngai, N. P. |lastauthoramp=yes |year=2011 |title= Moral Resources and Political Capital: Theorizing the Relationship Between Voluntary Service Organizations and the Development of Civil Society in China. Nonprofit and Voluntary Sector Quarterly. 40(2), 247–269 |accessdate=April 17, 2011 |url= http://nvs.sagepub.com/content/early/2009/07/23/0899764009340229.abstract |publisher=Nvs.sagepub.com }}</ref> However, in some countries they are treated as having separate [[legal personality]] for tax purposes.<ref>For example, in the United Kingdom an unincorporated association is assessable to [[corporation tax]].</ref> However, because of their lack of legal personality, [[Will (law)|legacies]] to unincorporated associations are sometimes subject to general common law prohibitions against [[Purpose trust#Unincorporated associations|purpose trusts]].
Associations that are organized for profit or financial gain are usually called [[partnership]]s.<ref>In most [[common law]] legal systems, partnership is defined by statute as "the relationship which subsists between persons carrying on a business in common with a view of profit"</ref> A special kind of partnership is a [[co-operative]] which is usually founded on one person—one vote principle and distributes its profits according to the amount of goods produced or bought by the members. Associations may take the form of a [[non-profit organization]] or they may be [[not-for-profit corporation]]s; this does not mean that the association cannot make benefits from its activity, but all the benefits must be reinvested. Most associations have some kind of document or documents that regulate the way in which the body meets and operates. Such an instrument is often called the organization's bylaws, constitution, regulations, or agreement of association.<ref>{{Cite book|title = Robert's Rules of Order Newly Revised In Brief|last = Robert III|first = Henry M.|publisher = Da Capo Press|year = 2011|isbn = 978-0-306-82019-9|location = Philadelphia, PA|pages = 85|edition = 2nd|display-authors=etal}}</ref>
==Common law==
===England and Wales=== {{Main article|Unincorporated associations in English law}} Under [[English law]], an unincorporated association consists of two or more members bound by the rules of a society which has at some point in time, been founded.<ref>{{cite book|last=Pettit |first=Philip |year=2009 |title=Equity and the Law of Trusts|publisher=Oxford University Press|isbn=978-0-19956102-5 |page=62}}</ref>
Several theories have been proposed as to the way that such associations hold rights. A transfer may be considered to have been made to the association's members directly as [[joint tenants]] or [[tenants in common]]. Alternatively, the funds transferred may be considered to have been under the terms of a private [[purpose trusts in English law|purpose trust]]. Many purpose trusts fail for want of a [[beneficiary]] and this may therefore may result in the gift failing. However, some purpose trusts are valid, and, accordingly, some cases have decided that the rights associated with unincorporated associations are held on this basis. The dominant theory, however, is that the rights are transferred to the members or officers absolutely, perhaps on trust for the members, but are importantly bound by contracts ''[[inter se]]''.<ref name="pettit6265">{{cite book|last=Pettit |first=Philip |year=2009 |title=Equity and the Law of Trusts|publisher=Oxford University Press|isbn=978-0-19956102-5 |pages=62–65}}</ref>
Accordingly, on dissolution, the distribution of these rights depends on how they were held. A purpose trust may by its nature survive the dissolution of the association, or it may not. If it fails as a result of the dissolution, then the rights will be held on [[resulting trusts in English law|resulting trust]] for the contributors, unless they can be shown to have renounced their right to such a trust in their favour. If the rights are held subject to contract, then they will be divided among the surviving membership upon dissolution, according to the terms of the contracts ''inter se'' or an implied term according to contribution. If, as a result of this contract or statute, no member can claim, the rights will pass to the Crown as ''[[bona vacantia]]''. This conclusion has also been suggested where the association dissolves because only one member remains, although this has been doubted by some commentators who believe the last members should be entitled to the rights.<ref name="pettit6265"/>
===Scotland=== [[Scottish law]] on unincorporated associations is essentially the same as English law.<ref>{{cite report |url=http://www.scotlawcom.gov.uk/download_file/view/357/ |title=Report on Unincorporated Associations |publisher=Scottish Law Commission |id=SCOT LAW COM No 217 |date=November 2009 |accessdate=1 February 2014 |quote=We are not aware of any material differences between the law of Scotland and the law of England and Wales regarding unincorporated associations.}}</ref>
===United States=== Each state sets its own laws as to what constitutes an unincorporated association and how it is to be treated under the laws. In the United States, voluntary associations which were incorporated were "pre-eminent" in collective action.<ref>Sacred Companies: Organizational Aspects of Religion and Religious Aspects of Organizations, [https://books.google.com/books?id=5OBplT1ehtgC&pg=PA107#v=onepage&q&f=false p108]. Oxford University Press.</ref> * In [[California]], during the 1980s, then [[Los Angeles County, California|Los Angeles County]] [[Los Angeles County District Attorney|district attorney]] [[Ira Reiner]] decided to use California's unincorporated associations law to attack [[street gangs]] and the habit of their members of tagging [[graffiti]] in public spaces, in an attempt to abate vandalism and to recover cleanup costs. He sued the street gangs by name, with cases titled such as ''City of Los Angeles v. [[Bloods|The Bloods]]'' and ''City of Los Angeles v. [[Crips|The Crips]]'', which then allowed the city to go after any member of the street gang, as a member of the unincorporated association being sued, for damages resulting from graffiti tagging involving that gang's name{{Citation needed|date=August 2015}}. * In [[Texas]], state law has statutes concerning unincorporated non-profit associations that allow unincorporated associations that meet certain criteria to operate as entities independent of their members, with the right to own property, make contracts, sue and be sued, with limited liability for their officers and members.<ref>{{cite web|title=Nonprofit Organizations|url=http://www.sos.state.tx.us/corp/nonprofit_org.shtml|publisher=Texas Secretary of State|accessdate=29 December 2012}}</ref> * [[New York (state)|New York]] state law regarding unincorporated associations actually gives members of the association more protection against liability than that given to either stockholders of [[corporation]]s or members of [[limited liability company|limited liability companies]]. This was noted in the case{{which|date=April 2013}} of the [[Associated Press]] organization, because the members of the AP are not liable for damages for the organization's actions unless the association as a whole approved it.
===Australia=== In most Australian states and territories, a similar set of laws allows not-for-profit associations to become legal entities with a limit to the liability of their members. An example of such a law, the Associations Incorporation Act that is in force in South Australia, allows for the creation of a legal entity able to buy and sell land and in general, enter into legally binding contracts.<ref>{{cite web|title=Associations Incorporation Act 1985|url=http://www.legislation.sa.gov.au/LZ/C/A/ASSOCIATIONS%20INCORPORATION%20ACT%201985.aspx|publisher=Government of South Australia, Attorney-General's Department|accessdate=17 October 2012}}</ref> Many clubs and societies begin life as an unincorporated body and seek to attain incorporated status to protect its members from legal liability and in many cases to seek government financial assistance only available to an incorporated body. Clubs and societies wishing to incorporate must meet the provisions of the relevant state act and lodge their constitution with the corresponding state government authority.<ref>{{cite web|title=How to incorporate|url=http://www.ocba.sa.gov.au/Associations/how/index.html|publisher=The Government of South Australia, Consumer & Business Services|accessdate=17 October 2012|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120924075924/http://www.ocba.sa.gov.au/Associations/how/index.html|archive-date=24 September 2012|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
==Civil law== Certain [[Civil law (legal system)|civil-law]] systems classify an '''association''' as a special form of [[contract]]ual relationship.
===Canada=== Under the [[Civil Code of Quebec|Quebec Civil Code]] an association is categorized as a type of statutory specific contract set forth in a constitution. An association can become incorporated with its own legal identity so that it may, e.g., open a bank account, enter into contracts (rent real estate, hire employees, take out an insurance policy), or sue or be sued.{{citation needed|date=February 2012}}
===France=== In [[France]], all voluntary associations are non-profit. They may count as unincorporated (''association non-déclarée'') or incorporated (''association déclarée''), and are created in terms of and governed by the [[Pierre Waldeck-Rousseau|Waldeck-Rousseau]] Act 1901. This is why ''[[:fr:Association loi 1901|association loi (de) 1901]]'' is subjoined to their name, except in [[Alsace]]-[[Moselle]] area which is governed by local law in this regard (the area was German in 1901) and are therefore called ''[[:fr:Association loi 1908|association loi (de) 1908]]''.{{citation needed|date=February 2012}}. If the association responding to defined criteria, like social or medical help for example, they can be declared "public utility association" (''association d'utilité publique'') by French authorities. Associations act 1901 let an important large of freedom about internal operation, like direction or authorized members for example.
===Germany=== {{Main article|Eingetragener Verein}} The [[Bürgerliches Gesetzbuch|German Civil Code]] sets out different rights and rules for an unincorporated association (''nicht eingetragener Verein'') with legal identity (''Vereine'', art. 21-79 [[Bürgerliches Gesetzbuch|BGB]]) versus an incorporated association (''eingetragener Verein'') with full [[legal person]]ality, which the law treats as partnerships (''Gesellschaften'', art. 705-740 [[Bürgerliches Gesetzbuch|BGB]]). Associations can be for-profit (''wirtschaftlicher Verein''), non-for-profit (''Idealverein''), or public (''gemeinnütziger Verein'').{{citation needed|date=February 2012}}
===Israel=== In [[Israel]], many non-profit organizations (NPOs) and non-governmental organizations (NGOs) are established as registered nonprofit associations (Hebrew ''amutah,'' plural ''amutot'') (some are established as public benefit companies (Hebrew ''Chevrah LeTo’elet Hatzibur'') not to be confused with [[public benefit corporation]]s). ‘‘Amutot’’ are regulated by the Associations Law, 1980. An ''amutah'' is a body corporate, though not a company. The ''amutah'' is successor to the Ottoman Society which predated the State of Israel, and was established by the now-superseded Ottoman Societies Law of 1909, based on the French law of 1901. An ''amutah'' must register with the ''Rasham Ha’amutot'' ('Registrar of Amutot'), under the purview of the ''Rashot Hata’agidim'' ('Corporations Authority') of the [[Ministry_of_Justice_(Israel)|Ministry of Justice]].
==Freedom of association== The freedom of association stands in the [[Universal Declaration of Human Rights]]:<ref>{{cite web|title=The Universal Declaration of Human Rights|url=https://www.un.org/en/documents/udhr/index.shtml|publisher=The United Nations|accessdate= September 8, 2012}}</ref> {{Cquote|Article 20 :(1) Everyone has the right to freedom of peaceful assembly and association. :(2) No one may be compelled to belong to an association.}}
[[Article 11 of the European Convention on Human Rights]] also protects the right to [[freedom of assembly]] and association.
{{Cquote|Article 11 – Freedom of assembly and association
# Everyone has the right to freedom of peaceful assembly and to freedom of association with others, including the right to form and to join trade unions for the protection of his interests. # No restrictions shall be placed on the exercise of these rights other than such as are prescribed by law and are necessary in a democratic society in the interests of national security or public safety, for the prevention of disorder or crime, for the protection of health or morals or for the protection of the rights and freedoms of others. This article shall not prevent the imposition of lawful restrictions on the exercise of these rights by members of the armed forces, of the police or of the administration of the State.}}

'''Xavier López Ancona''' has been the founder, president and chief executive officer of [[KidZania]] since 1999. López was ranked in the list of the most successful entrepreneurs in [[México]] according to ''[[Forbes]]''. Prior to his current position, he was the director of [[venture capital]] for [[General Electric Capital]]. He has a bachelor´s degree in [[Business administration|Business Administration]] from [[Anahuac University]], a master´s degree in administration from the Pan-American Institute of Business Administration ([[IPADE]]) in Mexico, and an MBA from the [[Kellogg Graduate School of Management]] at [[Northwestern University]].
== Early life == Xavier Lopez Ancona Martinez was born in [[Mexico City]] on April 4, 1964. His father, Isidro Lopez Martinez, worked at a variety of businesses, largely in the food industry and real estate. His mother was a housewife who raised seven children. As child, he wanted to be a [[Magician (fantasy)|magician]], and performed in nursing homes and orphanages. He later did a year of high school in [[Tulsa, Oklahoma|Tulsa]], Oklahoma.<ref name=":0">{{Cite web|url=http://www.milenio.com/negocios/FTMercados-Kidzania_Mexico-Director_de_Kidzania-Xavier_Lopez_Ancona_0_362963991.html.|title=Mexico Necesita Emprendedores|last=|first=|date=|website=Milenio|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref>
López comes from a large family. He has no children, but he has 16 nephews and enjoys taking them on trips, skiing and diving. <ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.promotexasmagazine.com/xavier-lopez-ancona-exportando-diversion-al-mundo-con-kidzania/|title=Exportando diversion al mundo con Kidzania|last=|first=|date=|website=promo texas magazine|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref>
== Education == López has a bachelor's degree in business administration from Anahuac University in Mexico City, a master's degree in administration from the Pan-American Institute of Business Administration (IPADE), and an MBA from the Kellogg Graduate School of Management at Northwestern University.<ref name=Encuesta> {{cite publication |title= Reenfocando la estratégia:Mercados emergentes, innovación y talento y un agenda compartida |work= Encuesta Global Anual CEO |pages=14, 86}}</ref>
== Business career == When his father's real estate company in the San Juan Ixhuatepec area went bankrupt in 1984, López supported his father. As a result he was given the task of selling most of the properties to avoid large losses.<ref name=":1">{{Cite web|url=https://www.entrepreneur.com/article/255050|title=Tips Xavier Lopez Ancona|last=|first=|date=|website=entrepreneur.com|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref>
López studied marketing under [[Philip Kotler]], while working toward his master’s degree. Kotler's classes, leadership and knowledge were key factors when López decided to start and launch the concept of KidZania.<ref name=":2">{{Cite book|title=Marketing de ciudades. Edición Mexico: Crear y prosperar en mercados de alto crecimiento.|last=|first=|publisher=LID Editorial|year=2017|isbn=|location=|pages=}}</ref> In 1999, Ancona founded Kidzania with the goal of making entertainment inclusive, as well as to increase its educational value.<ref name=":3">{{Cite book|title=Jugaad Innovation: Think Frugal, Be flexible, Generate Breakthrough Growth.|last=|first=|publisher=John Wiley & Sons|year=2017|isbn=|location=|pages=}}</ref> One of the most important lessons López learned during the process of taking KidZania from an entrepreneurial project to a [[multinational company]] was that businesses and cities are highly intertwined.<ref name=":1" />
== Kidzania == Ten million children have visited Kidzania to date.{{When|date=May 2017}}{{citation needed|date=May 2017}} Due to the success of the Mexico City park, López plans to open more parks in the U.S.<ref name=":3" />

{{distinguish|text=American writer [[Eric Liu]]}} {{Infobox Person|name=Liu Yu|image=Yu Liu Alibaba.jpg|birth_date={{Birth year and age|1986}}|birth_place=[[Beijing]], [[China]]|alma_mater=[[Vassar College]]|occupation=Entrepreneur|native_name=刘禹|residence=[[Hangzhou]], [[Zhejiang]], [[China]]}} '''Yu Liu''' ([[Chinese language|Chinese]]: 刘禹; born in 1986), also known as '''Eric Liu''', is a Chinese entrepreneur and the founder of One Cloud Technologies<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://media.people.com.cn/n/2013/0801/c40606-22402990.html|title=Liu Yu: Builder of a Language Ecosystem|last=|first=|date=|website=|publisher=People's Daily|access-date=}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://chuangye.cyz.org.cn/2015/0223/49966.shtml|title=Yu Liu - Entrepreneur and Founder of 365Fanyi|last=|first=|date=|website=|publisher=虎嗅|access-date=}}</ref> (operations and patents acquired by [[Alibaba Group]]<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://patentvue.com/2015/09/30/alibaba-patent-portfolio-swells-since-ipo/|title=Alibaba Patent Portfolio Swells Since IPO|last=|first=|date=2015-09-30|website=PatentVue by Envision IP|publisher=|access-date=}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://seekingalpha.com/article/4015883-copying-creating-chinese-tech-firms-eyeing-global-expansion|title=From Copying To Creating: Chinese Tech Firms Eyeing Global Expansion|last=Bodrog|first=Andy|date=2016-10-27|work=|newspaper=Seeking Alpha|language=en-US|access-date=|via=}}</ref>). Since 2015, Liu has been the head of Alibaba Group's language business unit.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://slator.com/features/eric-liu-on-the-launch-of-alibaba-language-services/|title=Eric Liu on the Launch of Alibaba Language Services {{!}} Slator|last=|first=|date=2016-06-21|work=|newspaper=Slator|language=en-US|access-date=|via=}}</ref> Liu is also a member of [https://locworld.com/about-us/our-advisory-committees/ LocWorld's advisory committee]<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://locworld.com/about-us/our-advisory-committees/|title=Advisory Committee|last=|first=|date=|website=LocWorld|publisher=|access-date=}}</ref> and a special advisor to [[Mobike]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://stories.ehf.org/ehf-fellow-yu-liu-eric-a38a706b96be|title=EHF Fellow: Yu Liu (Eric)|last=|first=|date=|work=|access-date=|via=EHF}}</ref>
== Early life == Liu was born in Beijing, China. He attended high school at [[Shanghai High School]] and received his bachelor degree from [[Vassar College]] in [[Poughkeepsie, New York|Poughkeepsie]], New York. While in college, he was the managing editor of the campus daily, the Vassar Miscellany News.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://my.tv.sohu.com/us/131274188/52080195.shtml?qq-pf-to=pcqq.discussion|title=Eric Liu - A Techie Tries to Communicate with the World|last=|first=|date=|website=|publisher=Sohu|access-date=}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://tv.cntv.cn/video/C10097/8e9c1354984e3dddcc830e240a4e5c44|title=BTV Entrepreneur Profile Liu Yu|last=|first=|date=|website=|publisher=BTV|access-date=}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.fromgeek.com/person/16318.html|title=Internet Language Pioneer Eric Liu|last=|first=|date=|website=|publisher=FromGeek|access-date=}}</ref>
== Career == In 2011, Liu built the [http://www.365fanyi.com/ 365Fanyi] ([[:zh-tw:365翻译|365翻译]])/ [http://www.zuodao.com/ Zuodao] (做到) dual-site crowdsourcing platform, one of the earliest and largest Internet-based language services in China,<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://tech.xinmin.cn/2015/02/10/26788134.html|title=Profile: Yu Liu of 365Fanyi|last=|first=|date=|website=|publisher=Xinmin|access-date=}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/alison-craiglow-hockenberry/getting-real-on-job-creation_b_919572.html|title=Getting Real on Job Creation|last=Hockenberry|first=Alison Craiglow|last2=|date=2011-08-05|website=The Huffington Post|publisher=|access-date=}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.techweb.com.cn/finance/2015-08-20/2191487.shtml|title=Alibaba Acquires the Largest Crowdsourcing Translation Platform|last=|first=|date=|website=TechWeb|publisher=|access-date=}}</ref> and was selected to be a 2011 [[Ashoka (non-profit organization)|Ashoka]] Changemaker,<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.changemakers.com/economicopportunity/entries/using-crowdsourcing-and-technology-empower-underprivile|title=Using crowdsourcing and technology to empower underprivileged talent with fair and flexible work opportunities - China|last=|first=|date=|website=Changemakers|publisher=|access-date=}}</ref> the only finalist from the country. The platform had been operated by One Cloud Technologies until Alibaba announced its acquisition in August 2015.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/research/stocks/private/snapshot.asp?privcapId=309711298|title=365fanyi: Private Company Information - Bloomberg|last=|first=|date=|website=Bloomberg|publisher=|access-date=}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://technode.com/2015/08/21/alibaba-acquires-365fanyi/|title=Alibaba Acquires Online Translation Platform 365 Fanyi To Boost Cross-Border Ecommerce|last=|first=|date=2015-08-21|website=TechNode|publisher=|access-date=}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.chinabusinessnews.com/1356-alibaba-group-holding-ltd-acquire-online-translator-365fanyi/|title=Alibaba Group Holding Ltd Acquire Online Translator 365Fanyi|last=Writer|first=Staff|date=|website=China Business News|publisher=|access-date=}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://seekingalpha.com/article/3462656-alibaba-adding-pieces-cross-border-ecommerce|title=Alibaba: Adding The Pieces To Cross-Border Ecommerce|last=|first=|date=2015-08-24|work=|newspaper=Seeking Alpha|language=en-US|access-date=|via=}}</ref> Early investors included Xu Xiaoping, Anna Fang,<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/forbesasia/2016/04/06/asias-power-businesswomen-2016-ones-to-watch/|title=Asia's Power Businesswomen, 2016: Ones To Watch|last=Asia|first=Forbes|date=|work=|newspaper=Forbes|access-date=|via=}}</ref> Zhenfund, [[Sequoia Capital|Sequoia China]] and CBC Capital.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.cbinsights.com/company/365-fanyi|title=365 Fanyi - CB Insights|last=|first=|date=|work=|access-date=|via=}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.chinamoneynetwork.com/2015/08/21/alibaba-acquires-zhen-fund-cbc-backed-365fanyi|title=Alibaba Acquires Zhen Fund, CBC-Backed 365Fanyi|last=|first=|date=2015-08-21|website=China Money Network|publisher=|access-date=}}</ref>
After the acquisition, Liu joined Alibaba Group to become the head of its language business unit. During his keynote speech at [https://www.taus.net/events/conferences/taus-annual-conference-2016#agenda TAUS Annual Conference 2016]<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.taus.net/events/conferences/taus-annual-conference-2016#agenda|title=TAUS Annual Conference 2016 - Keynote Speakers|last=Meer|first=Anne-Maj van der|date=|website=TAUS|publisher=|access-date=}}</ref> in Portland, Liu stated that the mission of Alibaba's language unit is to "prepare for a future without language barriers".<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.taus.net/think-tank/reports/event-reports/keynotes-summer-2016|title=Keynotes Summer 2016 - TAUS|last=|first=|date=|website=www.taus.net|publisher=|access-date=}}</ref> In January 2017, Liu announced that Alibaba will make a significant investment to integrate artificial intelligence into language technologies.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.jiemian.com/article/1053245.html|title=Eric Liu of Alibaba on Language in a Globalised World|last=|first=|date=|work=|access-date=|via=Jiemian}}</ref> Aside from his role at Alibaba, Liu is a special advisor to Mobike.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://stories.ehf.org/ehf-fellow-yu-liu-eric-a38a706b96be|title=EHF Fellow: Yu Liu (Eric)|last=|first=|date=|work=|access-date=|via=EHF}}</ref>
